meta.description: Lufthansa Business Lounge at Washington Dulles International Airport (IAD), Concourse B. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Lufthansa Business Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Near the Lufthansa Departure Gates B49-B51.

lounge.description: There's no better place to wait for your flight from the nation's capital. Enjoy a comfortable, peaceful, modern environment away from the airport terminal's hustle and bustle. Upgrade your pre-flight experience now.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.

For Priority Pass cardmembers: this lounge is only accessible for passengers departing on international flights. Access may be restricted between the hours of 15:00 - 18:00 daily due to space constraints.
Complimentary luggage storage available inside the lounge.
warning: This location does not accept passengers in airline uniforms.
To ensure the health and safety of guests, shower facilities will not be available during this time.
regulatory: Since all concourses at this airport are connected by people movers, all passengers departing from IAD can access this lounge.
Lounge bookings for this location are limited to non-corporate use. A tax invoice (according to respective taxation laws of selected countries) will not be issued.

reviews.content: Small, crowded, food options not great.
Keep on walking. No drinks except warm Coke and water.
If you have Priority Pass, the Turkish lounge is much better. During COVID, there's only chips, cold sandwiches, and a soda machine - no bar. The Turkish lounge has delicious hot food and a full bar.
Quiet but overpriced, not good enough.
It’s a pretty good lounge. I went there at 9am and there were lots of seats available. The shower is very decent and clean, and the staff are very gently.
Small, easily crowded but better food and alcohol options than United Clubs in C & D. Long walk if you’re in domestic side of A.
Very reasonable. Decent food, not elaborate.  Various drinks. Can board plane from lounge. Relaxing and lots of seats (probably around 60-70).
Relatively small. I visited on a weekday mid morning and it was not busy at all. Limited food and drink but certainly worth a detour.
Nice amenities and friendly staff.
I can only assume the good reviews for this lounge are from first time lounge users. Cramped, 1 toilet per gender, dirty shower, abrupt staff. Food is good but rarely are tables cleaned.
Noisy. Dirty dishes strewn about. Unwiped tables. Servers were absent.  Limited access to power.  Desk clerk had to manually enter voucher code. OK if you get this for free. Poor value to pay for.
I go here instead of United lounges when I have enough time. Small and crowded but better food and drink options. Staff always friendly.
Limited seating in this small lounge. Food options are decent. An array of self serve cold cuts, salads, pastries, and sweets. Solid WiFi. Would like to see better beer options.
I want to like this lounge - I really do but it's lacking. Customer service is subpar, the bar is tiny and the food looks like they found leftovers from grandma's fridge.
Very sad lounge. Rude staff (if you can find them), disappointing food and not very clean. Yuk.

Rather empty due to the late flight (10:30pm). Reasonable food selection. Alc. beverages at bar due to local liquor laws. Not the best but a good LH lounge for the wait. Direct boarding through lounge.
Beautiful lounge though no gate/plane view. Only one staff in lounge area off/on. Good food quality, OK selection, though no alcohol. Check in desk took a long time, ~15 min, though friendly.
Very impressed with this lounge for the price. Definitely worth stopping by if you're on a long lay over.
Not very big, limited selection of food. As others have pointed out, the basement location gives a certain ambience.
Quite a comfortable lounge. Nice range of snacks and drinks available. Would recommend grabbing one of the plush chairs in the lounge area in front of the TVs.
Awesome lounge with actual food for a full meal and great alcohol! Much better than all the domestic lounges. Great place to relax and unwind before departure.
Simply depressing! Couldn't stay there for longer than five minutes.
It's below the Senator Lufthansa lounge, so it isn't as bright (natural lighting), and there aren't as many plugs. The service is the same as upstairs (where I stayed the remainder of today's visit).
This is easily the best lounge at IAD. LUF lounges never disappoint. The food and drink quality were fantastic. I can't stress how good the food was. I'm always impressed w/ Lufthansa quality.
Worth the trek if you're hungry, good snack selection. Much nicer than United, but small and only one shower.
Modern lounge, but very crowded. Often impossible to find a seat. It's usually more comfortable waiting by the boarding gate.
Very well kept and modern looking lounge. Only a few years old. Good amenities but can get crowded in the late afternoon.
Gym like basement with uninspired food and uncomfortable seating. Toilets were broken - better facilities in the main airport terminal.
This lounge offers better amenities than the United Club does, and is quieter because people can't "buy-in". If your flight is departing from C or D, then remember to leave early to get to your gate!
It was nice and in theory the food was decent, but there were flies all over the place. If you judge a club by food/alcohol alone, an A+; but if cleanliness is important, then a C+.
Besides not having a business center, this lounge is great. It offer awesome showers, nice snacks, and a variety of seating areas.
For United flyers, this is the best lounge at IAD. I would recommend it.

location.terminalDirections: After security, near the Air France boarding area, close to Gate 22.

otherLounges.name: Etihad Airways Lounge (Chase Sapphire Lounge by The Club)

location.terminalDirections: Located between Concourses A and B, in front of Gate A32 and the main Duty Free Store.
Concourse B, at the top of the escalators after arriving from AeroTrain

otherLounges.name: British Airways The Concorde Dining Room

location.terminalDirections: Near the Lufthansa Departure Gates B49-B51.
After Security, take the shuttle bus or train to Concourse C. Location is near Gate C14.
On the Arrivals (Baggage Claim) Level, across from Baggage Claim #11 and #12.
Located just past the main security checkpoint.
